title: Verizon workers find decomposed male corpse in midtown Manhattan manhole
text:
The decomposed body of a man was found in a New York City manhole early Tuesday morning, NYPD officials have confirmed.

Authorities say a Verizon crew was installing phone lines on West 58th Street and Eight Avenue in Columbus Circle when they discovered the body some time after 3:00am.

The three men first noticed a strong smell when they removed the manhole cover.

But once inside, they saw the body which they said looked like it had been there for a number of days.

The men kept their distance and dialed 911. When officers arrived on the scene they confirmed the man was deceased and his body in a state of decomposition.

It’s not immediately clear how the man died or how he got into the man hole. Then men saying lifting a manhole cover is a two person job, with each cover weighing 200 lbs and requiring a tool to open.

Investigators say they believe the man was homeless. He has not yet been identified.

The road remained cornered off by police for several hours while officers interviewed witnesses and worked to extract the man’s body from below the ground.

The road has since re-opened and the investigation remains on-going.

An NYPD spokesperson has not responded for a DailyMail.com request for comment.
description: Authorities say a Verizon crew was installing phone lines on West 58th Street and Eight Avenue in Columbus Circle, New York, when they discovered the body some time after 3:00am.
